alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Stanton; Thurston (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 6:33AM CDT until August 02 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Iowa, including the following county, Monona. Portions of Nebraska, including the following counties, Burt, Colfax, Cuming, Dodge, Stanton, Thurston and Washington. * WHEN...Until 945 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 632 AM CDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Point, Onawa, Stanton, Oakland, Wisner, Pender, Scribner, Lyons, Beemer, Clarkson, Dodge, Howells, Bancroft, Decatur, Pilger, Snyder, Uehling, Craig, Rosalie and the Highway 9 And 51 Junction. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
